name: Cherry and Jicama Salad With Lime and Macadamia Nuts
description: Bright red cherries, crispy and juicy jicama, fresh basil, and buttery macadamia nuts make for an extremely easy, refreshing, and decidedly different salad for your spring table.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/4 pound red cherries (565g), halved and pitted
1 pound jicama (from 1 jicama root; about 450g); peeled and cut into batons
1 small handful torn fresh basil leaves
Zest of 1 lime plus fresh lime juice to taste (from 1 to 2 limes)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large salad or mixing bowl, combine cherries, jicama, basil, and macadamia nuts. Add lime zest and drizzle on just enough olive oil to lightly coat all ingredients. Toss well. Add lime juice to taste (should be bright and tart enough to contrast with the sweet cherries and rich olive oil), tossing well, and season with salt. Serve.
